title: Britain's Got Talent star to stand trial over alleged child neglect
text:
News Britain's Got Talent star to stand trial over alleged child neglect Dancer Leeroy Bailey - who missed out in the final to opera singer Paul Potts - has been prohibited from coming into contact with anyone under 18 without supervision Share It is alleged that Bailey neglected a child 'in a manner likely to cause suffering or injury to health' (Photo: Coventry Telegraph) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A former Britain’s Got Talent finalist will appear in court today to face child neglect charges. 
Leeroy Bailey, 36, competed on the hit talent show with dance troupe Kombat Breakers in 2007, losing in the final to Paul Potts . 
Bailey is due in court today for a trial over child neglect allegations, the Coventry Telegraph reports. 
It is alleged that the dance teacher neglected a child “in a manner likely to cause suffering or injury to health” in February last year. Read More Leeroy Bailey will stand trial today (Photo: Birmingham Mail) The Kombat Breakers missed out to Paul Potts (Photo: CT) 
The 35-year-old originally denied the charge at Coventry Magistrates Court in May 2016 and elected to have the case heard by a jury at crown court. 
The trial will take place at Warwick Crown Court. 
Bailey remains on bail with one condition that he has to be supervised if he comes into contact with anyone under the age of 18. 
This includes any dance classes that Bailey - who has worked as a dance teacher, actor and model - may teach. Like us on Facebook
